fields.principle: Customer satisfaction through early and continuous software delivery
fields.description: Customers are happier when they receive working software at regular intervals, rather than waiting extended periods of time between releases.

fields.principle: Accommodate changing requirements throughout the development process
fields.description: The ability to avoid delays when a requirement or feature request changes.
Scrum accommodates this principle since the team operates in software sprints or iterations that ensure regular delivery of working software.

fields.principle: Collaboration between the business stakeholders and developers throughout the project
fields.description: Better decisions are made when the business and technical team are aligned.

fields.principle: Support, trust, and motivate the people involved
fields.description: Motivated teams are more likely to deliver their best work than unhappy teams.
Communication is more successful when development teams are co-located.

fields.principle: Working software is the primary measure of progress
fields.description: Delivering functional software to the customer is the ultimate factor that measures progress.

fields.principle: Agile processes to support a consistent development pace
fields.description: Teams establish a repeatable and maintainable speed at which they can deliver working software, and they repeat it with each release.

fields.principle: Attention to technical detail and design enhances agility
fields.description: The right skills and good design ensures the team can maintain the pace, constantly improve the product, and sustain change.
Develop just enough to get the job done for right now.

fields.principle: Self-organizing teams encourage great architectures, requirements, and designs
fields.description: Skilled and motivated team members who have decision-making power, take ownership, communicate regularly with other team members, and share ideas that deliver quality products.

fields.principle: Regular reflections on how to become more effective
fields.description: Self-improvement, process improvement, advancing skills, and techniques help team members work more efficiently.
